abstract: Intel said it would join the board of the One Laptop Per Child Foundation, which seeks to build inexpensive computers for the developing world.
snippet: Intel said it would join the board of the One Laptop Per Child Foundation, which seeks to build inexpensive computers for the developing world.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, July 13 — The Intel Corporation reversed ground Friday and joined the board of the One Laptop Per Child Foundation, an ambitious effort to seed the developing world with inexpensive portable computers.

headline.main: Intel, in Shift, Joins Project on Education
headline.print_headline: Intel, in Shift, Joins Project On Education
